fpps.outputTitle: FPPS (Fixed Priority Preemptive Scheduling) Algorithm Output

hrrn.outputTitle: HRRN (Highest Response Ratio Next) Algorithm Output

fifo.outputTitle: FIFO (First In, First Out) Algorithm Output

rltf.outputTitle: RLTF (Remaining Longest Time First) Algorithm Output

algorithmDescriptions.FIFO: The FIFO algorithm executes processes in the order they arrive.
algorithmDescriptions.SJF: The SJF algorithm selects the process with the shortest burst time.
algorithmDescriptions.SRT: In SRTF, the process with the shortest remaining time is selected next.
algorithmDescriptions.LJF: The LJF algorithm executes the process with the longest burst time first.
algorithmDescriptions.RLTF: In RLTF, the process with the longest remaining time is prioritized.
algorithmDescriptions.RR: In Round Robin, each process gets a fixed time slice in cyclic order.
algorithmDescriptions.Priority Non-Preemptive: In Non-Preemptive Priority, processes are executed based on priority without preemption.
algorithmDescriptions.MLQ: In the Multilevel Queue (MLQ) algorithm, processes are divided into queues based on their type, and each queue has its own scheduling policy.
algorithmDescriptions.MLFQ: In the Multilevel Feedback Queue (MLFQ) algorithm, processes can move between queues to improve responsiveness and system efficiency.
algorithmDescriptions.EDF: In the EDF algorithm, the process with the nearest deadline is executed first.
algorithmDescriptions.FPPS: In the FPPS algorithm, each process has a fixed priority, and the process with the highest priority always executes first.
algorithmDescriptions.HRRN: In the HRRN algorithm, the process with the highest response ratio (Waiting + Burst) / Burst is executed next.

about.subtitle: About the Project
about.title: CPU Scheduling Algorithms Simulator
about.text1: This website is an interactive simulator for CPU scheduling algorithms, designed to enhance learning and understanding of operating system concepts.
about.sectionTitle: Deep Understanding Through Thoughtful Design and Creative Solutions
about.sectionLead: We believe in purposeful creation—where every detail serves a greater purpose, and every project reflects our commitment to quality.
about.sectionText1: This project aims to transform complex CPU scheduling concepts into a visual and intuitive learning experience for students and enthusiasts. You can experiment with algorithms like FCFS, SJF, SRTF, Priority, and Round Robin using custom data.
about.quote: “Excellence is never an accident; it is the result of high intention, sincere effort, and intelligent execution.”
